object.description:
You can swim. Swimming in calm water does not need a Test to succeed.
The test is required if there are any adverse conditions such as: currents, cold water, extra encumbrance, etc.
In combat, Swim is used when fighting in the water (deep). It replaces skills like Athletics to govern Movement. Your swim speed is half of your Movement speed.
object.name: Swim

object.description: You have a vast knowledge of culture and history of Dwarfs in the Old World.
object.name: Lore - Dwarfs

object.description: Lets you create works of art. To use Art without extra penalties you have to have access to appropriate Trade Tools. Large projects might require extended Tests. SL determines the quality of your work.

object.description:
Lets you look into the future. This can be done in a few different ways:
Priests and Sisters receive prophetic visions.
Celestial Wizards read future from the stars.
Mystics use tools such as cards or dice.
Consulting the Thaumodivinator in Altdorf.
Consorting with Daemons. 
You can make a single Augury Test one per day.
object.name: Augury

object.description:
Lets you hide and move undetected in a urban environment. Stealth Test is Opposed by opponent's Perception Skill. The Test is modified by a number of situational factors such as: lighting condition, your camouflage, etc.
In combat, Stealth can be used to prepare for an Ambush.
object.name: Stealth - Urban

object.description: Describes how good one is at conducting research. Research requires Read/Write talent.
object.name: Research

object.description: Describes how well you move and perform physical activities such as jumping or running.
object.name: Athletics

object.description: Represents your understanding of pigeons, and the ability to train them.
object.name: Animal Training - Pigeon

object.description:
You know how to set and disarm traps. Everyone with this Skill can set and disarm traps without any Test if given enough time.
The test is necessary if trap is unusually complex or if there is a time pressure.
Most traps require Average (+20) Set Trap Test to succeed. More complex traps may require an extended Test that needs multiple SL over a number of rounds.
object.name: Set Trap

object.description:

It can be used to entertain patrons or (with permission of your GM) to give you an extra edge in combat.
object.name: Perform - Fight

object.description: Represents your understanding of horses, and the ability to train them.
object.name: Animal Training - Horse

object.description:
Let's you perform nimble hand movements that allow to pick pockets, perform car/coin tricks, etc. Test of this Skill is usually Opposed by the Perception of your target.
You can also use this Skill in gambling.  Before any round you may attempt Sleight of Hand Test (Opposed if other are suspecting you). If you succeed to may reverse your Gamble Test tat round if necessary.
object.name: Sleight of Hand

object.description:
Allows you to befriend or subjugate animals.
Take an Opposed Charm Animal/Willpower test. If the animal(s) is docile, this Test is not Opposed. You can influence WP Bonus + SL animals at once.
In combat, if you succeed, any affected animals will not attack you this round and you gain +1 Advantage. You can use this skill every Round until you fail the Test. After failing, you cannot use it on the same animals anymore.
object.name: Charm Animal

object.description: Help with orientation in wilderness using any means available: maps, landmarks, stars, etc.
object.name: Navigation

object.description: Lets you create written works of art. To use Art - Writing without extra penalties you have to have access to writing Trade Tools. Large projects might require extended Tests. SL determines the quality of your work.

object.description: Training and experience with weapons from the Bow group.

object.description:
Lets you hide and move undetected in an underground environment.  Stealth Test is Opposed by opponent's Perception Skill. The Test is modified by a number of  situational factors such as: lighting condition, your camouflage, etc.
In combat, Stealth can be used to prepare for an Ambush.
object.name: Stealth - Underground

object.description: Ability to understand and speak jargon used by members of a  particular guild.
object.name: Language - Guilder

object.description: You can entertain people near you by telling them prophecies. The SL of the Entertain Test shows how much others like your performance.

object.description: Ability to speak Battle tongue. Battle Tongue is a set of simple commands and gestures that enable efficient coordination in combat situation.

object.name: Lore - Local - Moot

object.description: Lets you create particularly beautiful maps. To use Art - Cartography without extra penalties you have to have access to writing Trade Tools. Large projects might require extended Tests. SL determines the quality of your work.

object.description:
Your ability to operate a Carrack or a similar ship. You are automatically presumed to be able to sail in calm water. 
Test is usually necessary when sailing in adverse conditions or racing.
You can use Sail as a basic Skill with any other Specialisations.

object.description: Ability to handle alcohol without  suffering its negative consequences.

object.description:
You can recognize the most subtle signs that allows you to follow others.
This Skill can be also used to hide your own trail. Whoever is following you will have to take Track Test Opposed by your Track Test.
Tracking usually requires an Extended Test with the Difficulty modified by factors such as: how fresh the trail is, etc.
GM my chose to use Pursuit rules to check if you are able to track down a fleeing animal.
object.name: Track

object.description:
By having a level in this Skill, you are automatically assumed to be able to row in calm water.
The Row Skill Test is usually necessary when rowing in some adverse conditions or racing.
object.name: Row
